event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_PRISTINE
event.text: Emerging from your jump, you find yourself in the embrace of a pristine star system, still untouched by the tide of colonists that sweep through this sector. The ethereal beauty of this unspoiled expanse is a fleeting treasure you know won't remain hidden for long. Before you lies a mineral-rich ring, its untouched splendor encircling a majestic gas giant, a sight rarely seen in the reaches of space you traverse but one that tempts you to spoil it.

choice.text: (Beam Drones) Attempt to harvest the ring.

event.text: Giving into the temptation, you navigate your ship into the mineral-rich ring encircling the gas giant. As your vessel penetrates the shimmering veil, the brilliant particles come alive in a mesmerizing ballet. Mining drones hum to life, diligently extracting the valuable resources that have remained untouched until now. Each haul underscores the untouched grandeur of this system, yet as your ship departs, laden with riches, you can't shake the feeling that your actions have irreversibly shifted the balance of this pristine sanctuary.

Opting to momentarily set aside the allure of riches, you choose instead to focus on your ship's upkeep. Against the backdrop of the mineral-rich ring's beauty, you take a moment to appreciate the untouched serenity of the cosmos. The interplay of particles becomes a soothing reminder of the universe's majesty, offering a respite from the clamor of ambition as our FTL drive hums in the background as it charges.

Amid the satisfaction of your successful harvest, fate takes an abrupt turn. The ship becomes ensnared within the ring's embrace, and asteroids awaken to pummel your ship. Your ship is unscathed just yet but urgency fills the air as your crew fights to charge their FTL drive to get out before the universe decides to punish us any further.

With a determined resolve, you steer your ship into the heart of the mineral-rich ring encircling the gas giant. The glittering particles come alive as your vessel passes through them, a breathtaking cosmic display. Your crew works tirelessly, manually extracting the valuable resources that have remained untouched until now. As your ship departs the ring, laden with riches, a sense of reverence mingles with the weight of responsibility. It's clear that your presence has initiated a transformation of this once-undisturbed haven.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_MIXED_SETTLEMENTS
event.text:
Emerging from your jump, you find yourself amidst a remarkable tableau. A lush planet stretches before you, transformed into a testament of unity. Alien races, once estranged, now work together, their ships repurposed into temporary shelters and structures within their budding settlements. Various alien races such as the Orchids, Rockmen, Aquarians, Slugs, and Humans have gathered here and call this land their home, a rare and heartening sight in a universe often marked by strife.
You are left to wonder if it is a fleeting collaboration or perhaps it may hold the answers to a more peaceful universe. The latter may hold some merit, as the settlers have offered an invitation to land and join them for some freshly made pastries and a small helping of left over scrap materials from their ships' conversions.

event.name: ASTEROID_REFINERY
event.text: A small Union refinery is operating away from all the asteroids. Though they mostly just process raw ores, you can probably pay them to refine some of your scrap.

choice.text: Pay them to create a weapon.

event.text: "Bit of an unconventional request, but we appreciate the donation. We'll see what we can do."

choice.text: Pay them to create an augment.

event.text: "Bit of an unconventional request, but we appreciate the donation. We'll see what we can do."
"Wait wait! What did we do?!" You mute the civilians and open fire.
There likely isn't anything good to come out of exploring this place. Let's move on.

event.name: ASTEROID_CACHE
event.text: Unfortunately, the beacon here has been engulfed by an intense swarm of asteroids. You're about to prepare to leave when you notice several radar blips. An artificial object, hollow, is drifting amongst the rocks. If you had to guess, it's likely a supply cache.

choice.text: We're already getting pelted. We should just leave.

event.text: Too risky trying to access the cache. You distance yourself away from the swarm of asteroids.

You take some damage trying to open the cache, but fortunately it's nothing too major. Inside, it seems it's mostly drone parts and schematics. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly drone parts and schematics. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.

You take some damage trying to open the cache, but fortunately it's nothing too major. Inside, it seems it's mostly ammo and weapons. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly ammo and weapons. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.

You take some damage trying to open the cache, but fortunately it's nothing too major. Inside, it seems it's mostly fuel and augments. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.
You make it to the cache without a scratch. Inside, it seems it's mostly fuel and augments. You don't have time to pull apart the whole thing, but you do take back an impressive haul.

event.name: ASTEROID_DEADPLATFORM
event.text: A rather large mining platform has been embedded on the side of a hollowed-out asteroid. It's not returning any hails and shows no signs of activity, but you aren't sure just how long it has been abandoned, or for what reasons.
There likely isn't anything good to come out of exploring this place. Let's move on.
You land on the platform and move to investigate, when a pirate vessel appears from behind the asteroid! It was using the platform as a trap!

The platform is more battered than you originally thought. The shield generator is running on fumes, and the crew are long since gone. You aren't sure why they left, but a substantial amount of fuel is left over.

You step aboard the station only to find a Rockman, a former resident of the platform, locked in the cargo bay. He's terrified when you open the doors, but you manage to calm him. He explains that a pirate raid slaughtered the crew, and that he was the only survivor.

You board the station only to notice the shield generator is still functional. You strip it of parts and use them to upgrade your own shields, though you're uncertain what led to the station being abandoned.

event.name: ASTEROID_HURTMINER
event.text: It seems another ship is exploring the beacon through the dense asteroid field. However, moments after you spot them, a large asteroid strikes their ship, crippling their engines and sending them flying!

choice.text: Attempt to salvage some of the wreckage from the collision.
(Upg. Piloting) Use your advanced auto-pilot to correct their trajectory.
(Arm Upgrade) Use your arm to correct their trajectory.

event.text: You latch onto the ship and pull them out of the path of the larger asteroids. You take a little bit of a beating, but the captain is very grateful for your help and, considering his ship is totaled, he offers to help you instead.
You're not willing to put yourself through the same risk.

You reach the civilian ship using some cables and manage to correct their trajectory just in time to avoid collision. Their ship is toast, but you convince them to come with you until you can transport them to a safe location. One of them offers to remain behind to help you.

You reach the civilian ship using some cables and manage to correct their trajectory just in time to avoid collision. Their ship is heavily beaten up but they insist they'll be fine. They pay you for saving them.

You chase after the civilians, but several more asteroids strike your hull. You manage to reach their ship - just as it collides with a massive asteroid, obliterating it entirely. You pull away in time, but there's nothing to do but pick up some of the salvage and get out.

You reach the civilian ship and using some cables manage to correct their trajectory just in time to avoid collision. Their ship is toast, but you convince them to come with you until you can transport them to a safe location. One of them offers to remain behind to help you.

You reach the civilian ship and using some cables manage to correct their trajectory just in time to avoid collision. Their ship is heavily beaten up but they insist they'll be fine. They pay you for saving them.
You move closer to try and pick up some of the scrap metal, but it seems the ship has corrected its trajectory on its own. They don't take very kindly to you trying to screw them over, and open fire!

You move closer to try and pick up some of the scrap metal, but it seems the ship has corrected its trajectory on its own. "Damn Renegades! All you care about is scrap! Don't think we won't tell the Rebels about this!"
The civilian ship spirals away, crashing into a much larger asteroid. Nothing else disturbs you as you collect the wreckage.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_NEUTRAL_ENFORCED
event.text: The space station here is of extraordinary size, a marvel of engineering. It appears to function as a permanent orbital habitat. You consider docking here for some well-deserved respite and to browse the stores. However, you catch the familiar orange hue of a Rebel ship comes into view, already docked at the station. An automated transmission interrupts your thoughts: "You have entered a no-fire zone. Weapon discharge will not be tolerated." It seems that you shouldnâ€™t find any trouble here, yet the prospect of sharing the same space with a Rebel ship leaves you feeling conflicted.

choice.text: Dock at the station to trade and ignore the Rebel.

event.text: You secure your ship at the station, situated adjacent to a bustling trade depot. You commence your inspection of the array of valuable technologies on offer for purchase.
You decide to pass on docking at the station and decide to do something else.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_ATTACK_REBEL
event.text: Defiant in the face of warnings, you refuse to abide the presence of the Rebel ship and launch an assault, eliciting shock from both the Rebel crew and the surrounding civilians. As anticipated, the station's ASB battery springs to life in retaliation, its weaponry converging on your vessel. To compound the situation, an automated message further aggravates the situation by listing an ongoing tally of your past and present infractions.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_ATTACK_ENGINEER
event.text: Defiant in the face of warnings, you refuse to abide the presence of the Rebel ship and launch an assault, eliciting shock from both the Rebel crew and the surrounding civilians. As anticipated, the station's ASB battery springs to life in retaliation, its weaponry converging on your vessel. To compound the situation, an automated message further aggravates the situation by listing an ongoing tally of your past and present infractions.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_ATTACK_TURNCOAT
event.text: Defiant in the face of warnings, you refuse to abide the presence of the Rebel ship and launch an assault, eliciting shock from both the Rebel crew and the surrounding civilians. As anticipated, the station's ASB battery springs to life in retaliation, its weaponry converging on your vessel. To compound the situation, an automated message further aggravates the situation by listing an ongoing tally of your past and present infractions.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_ATTACK_GUARD
event.text: Despite the warnings, you attempt to engage the Rebel ship presuming the station would turn a blind eye to your transgression. Yet, to your surprise the station's guards swiftly spring to action and move in to intercept you! grants the Rebel ship the opportunity to undock and escape, leaving you in the clutches of the station's guards.

event.name: ASTEROID_ABUSE
event.text: Despite not having authority to do so in the Free Excavation Act, a Coalition station is operating in full view, harvesting the asteroids near this beacon.

A Mantis captain, wearing a smug grin, appears on your camera. "Hahah, are you thinking of so, captain? Big riot, FREE Excavation act! You forgetting doctrine saying nothing of Federation, but you exploiting merely of Union and Ministry benefits. Well, funny pebble man and gross worm thing sign act too! And if you are noticing, we are having funny pebble man AND gross worm thing on board. Thus, Coalition having as much right as you are! Hahah! Dumb dumb!"
"Hahahah, yes, fight me infant brain man! I welcome your slaughter! Hahah!"
"What?! No! No no! You aren't supposed to be agreeing! You getting mad! Madder! Agh! Curses you! Hmph. Well, uh, not knowing what to do now. Uh... you needing sell and buy things?"

choice.text: (Anti-Bio Weapon) Snipe the Rockman and Leech.

event.text: You configure your weapon and lock onto both of the crew the Mantis had proudly displayed, near instantly killing them both. The Mantis gawks in horror. "You are... how?! This cheating! Agh!" From offscreen the Slug aboard shuffles on. "Heh. You kinda sssuck. I'm outta here, Fed dude'sss got cooler gunsss."
You have nothing to gain but conflict from bothering these guys. Better to stay away.

event.name: ASTEROID_REBELOUTPOST
event.text: Seems a small Rebel outpost has been stealthily placed between the asteroids here. By law they aren't meant to be here, but mining operations aren't exactly known for hurting anyone.

choice.text: Take the law into your own hands!

event.text: "Damn you! And you wonder why there was ever a Rebellion! This isn't law, this is corruption!"

choice.text: (Forged ID) Pretend to be Rebels to trade.

event.text: You can tell the Rebels are skeptical, but apparently they're desperate to sell off some old equipment thanks to a lack of support this far from Rebel space.
Harmless or not, bothering these Rebels is risky. Better not to get involved.

The Rebels seem extremely cautious speaking with you. You start to catch on and decide to leave quickly. Chances are with the way that went they probably won't be very reluctant to give the fleet information about this sighting.

"You're a Renegade, no? I can't say we could see eye to eye on everything, but I can see the allure. Sometimes I want to leave this place behind too, but I have a duty to fulfill. Still, it's rare seeing someone like you who doesn't rush into combat. Take care, friend. May we never have to draw guns against each other."

"From the moment you jumped in I thought we were dead. Glad to see a friendly face, even if you are a Fed... Yeah, I know we're breaking the rules, but what's a little rock mining going to do? If you aren't too worried about the legality, maybe we could strike a trade?"

event.name: ASTEROID_STANDOFF
event.text: Despite the presence of a large approaching asteroid storm, two ships appear to be in the middle of a standoff. A Ministry and Theocracy ship are squaring off over access to some sort of depot. As expected, the Rockmen are using offensive racial slurs and the Zoltans are spewing legal jargon. What else is new?
You think for a moment the Zoltans are considering helping you, until they suddenly jump away! The reason is obvious moments later when the beacon is engulfed by the approaching asteroid storm!

As you lock onto the Zoltan ship, the Rockmen continue to provide 'support' by shouting more obscenities at the Zoltan. That is, until the asteroids engulf the beacon and the Rockmen give up and abandon the depot!

choice.text: (Upg. Cloaking) Stealthily raid the depot yourself.

event.text: You slip past the two squabbling ships and storm the depot, grabbing everything that isn't nailed down that's within reach, and quickly leave.

choice.text: These two can duke it out alone.

event.text: Coming between two vessels like these is pointless. Best let them handle each other like the manchildren they are.

event.name: ASTEROID_STANDOFF_DEPOT
event.text: With the ship out of the way, you have the opportunity to go after the depot yourself - but you might take some extra damage from the asteroids!
You storm the depot, grabbing everything that isn't nailed down that's within reach and quickly leave. Some asteroids strike your hull, but hopefully it was worth it.

event.name: ASTEROID_ENGILAB
event.text: You receive a hail from a nearby Engi station monitoring the nearby asteroid fields. "Engi presence is with permission of Ministry. Goals: test and establish remote mining operation through use of drone technology. Problem: Vagabond settlement continues to steal tech. Solution: Federation vessel may 'blow shit up'. Can a deal be made?"
"There is an understanding - you are at a lack of the limited resource of time. Three Vagabond ships have been identified as problematic. We request you defeat one."

choice.text: Take on the ship populated by Gouls.

event.text: "Understood. Coordinates for target are being transfered."

choice.text: Take on the ship populated by Mares.

event.text: "Understood. Coordinates for target are being transfered."

choice.text: Take on the ship populated by Wraiths.

event.text: "Understood. Coordinates for target are being transfered."

choice.text: Ignore the Engi and attack them instead!

event.text: "Critical error. Unexpected hostility from Federation vessel. Appropriate response: 'oh shit'. Activating combat protocols."
"Your response has been evaluated as: rude. Unfortunate circumstances. We will cease contact with your vessel."

event.name: ASTEROID_ENGILAB_CONTACT
event.text: "Impressive demonstration. Federation vessel has successfully 'kicked ass'. Payment is due. Expect to receive reward momentarily."

event.name: DISTRESS_ASTEROID_FREEDUMB
event.text: The distress beacon here is coming from a Rock mining platform, which has taken heavy damage. They hail you almost immediately; "We don't care who you are or what your stake is - there are some lunatic Mantis running around here massacring us by the dozen! We need you to track them down and put an end to this murder!"

choice.text: Agree to track down the murderers.

event.text: You make some scans of the system and detect another ship some distance away. Moving closer reveals it to be piloted by Free Mantis, who greet you with great jubilation. "Merry day, captain! You are coming here claiming great bounties too?"

choice.text: Are you the ones killing Theocracy miners?

event.text: "Huh? Not knowing what you are talking of. We come here harvest rocks! Many rocks, they tell us! Kill rock, it gives you fuel! And when I am hearing this, I thinking to myself, 'This is making greatest profits!' You are saying words is wrong? Truth be, we not finding any fuel! Doing something wrong I am thinking..."

choice.text: You've been terribly mistaken - the Rockmen are not asteroids.

event.text: "What? You are saying there is a Rock... AND man? Is this why screaming and running when I slice them open? Huh... Revolutionary ideas! You think big smart, biggest smarter even! Some days I wishing I have biggest smart. So, I come with you, and hoping knowledge coming off with me!"
"Oh, okay! Just unlucky supposing. Many thanks, captain! While not having many fuels, we do offering you great basket of assorted metals we pick from bigger rock after small ones dead!"
The Rockmen make no attempt to say anything more.

event.name: DISTRESS_ASTEROID_BACTERIA
event.text: As soon as you arrive a Zoltan science vessel hails you, deeply concerned. "It is a woeful day, captain! You must help us! Despite ordinance section C67I-O23W-B... er... maybe it was C, not B... regardless, despite being in violation of very important rulings, a nearby Confederate outpost has had the AUDACITY to pollute this region, and it has endangered a very rare species of completely useless asteroid-borne microbacteria no one cares about! This cannot stand!"

"Oh thank goodness. I was afraid I'd have to do something for myself for once. Welp, here are the co-ordinates. Do whatever it is you renegades do and go murder them or something." You make your way to the outpost, which is protected by a single ship.
Words are for pansies. Your job as a mercenary is to kill, and kill you shall. In the name of... useless microbacteria.

choice.text: Try and explain to the Vampweeds.

event.text: "I'm afraid I don't understand. Why do these bacteria matter? And what do you mean by 'stop polluting'? What are we polluting? We produce about as much waste, if not less, as any other settlement in this sector."

choice.text: A Zoltan told us all this. We're just mercenaries.

event.text: "Uhuh... and why should I care? We aren't Ministry citizens. Hell, the Ministry was only included in the Excavation Acts because we knew they'd be the most careful of enforcing them. I understand you have a job to do... but maybe you could just, I dunno, tell the Zoltan you did it anyways?"

You head back to the Zoltan and inform them the job is complete. Despite having no proof you did anything, the Zoltan lights up. "Incredible work! Now we can all go on to continue not caring about the bacteria in peace! Here's your reward!"

choice.text: Finish the job properly and kill the Vampweeds.

event.text: You promised to help the Zoltan, and you'll follow through with it. Prepare for combat!
"Gah, you're worthless. Why is no one willing to do my work FOR me?!"

event.name: ASTEROID_BACTERIA_HELP
event.text: "Incredible work! Now we can all go on to continue not caring about the bacteria in peace! Here's your reward!"

event.name: QUEST_ASTEROID_TRANSPORT
event.text: A small Eargen transport hails you, their Leech captain bleeding from a long gash down its back. "You, you can help us. We're supposed to be taking these back to the Capital, but some pirates got in our way and stole the cargo. We're in no fighting order, but maybe you could get it back for us?"
"Great. We had a tracking beacon in the cargo, and those idiots seem to have grabbed it themselves. Shouldn't be too hard to track them down."
You apologize, but you aren't here to run errands.

event.name: ASTEROID_TRANSPORT_PIRATES

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Leech captain asked for your help to retrieve a stolen cargo from pirates.

event.text: It seems you've found the pirate ship in question. With no time to waste, you engage them immediately. Be careful not to damage the cargo!

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROCK_FRONTIER
textList.text: A lone rock vessel is lost in the distant stars far from their colonies. Instead of turning to you for salvation, they've decided to take their frustration out on you.

Sensors indicate a single Rock vessel holding in an attack stance broadcasting to you on open channels. "The Gods have blessed me with the beauty of this sector and I won't let you spread the Federations blight here. Perish!"

A rock ship has taken a journey through this sector on a pilgramage in search of their place in the universe. Your attempts to hail them interrupts their meditation. Taking offense at your act, they arm their weapons!

The Rockmen are hardy people: What may look like a completely uninhabitable planet below is actually in the process of having a colony established. However, a Rock patrol ship protecting the colony considers you a pirate and decides to ward you off with extreme prejudice.
The Theocracy often takes no chances with outsiders and this is even more so evident out in the frontier. They arm their weapons and you follow in kind.
"Outsider! These lands are claimed by the Theocracy! You have insulted us with your presence, prepare to die!" A fight is unavoidable.
You encounter a Rock vessel and attempt to open trading frequencies, but they take it as an act of cultural transgression and open fire.

It looks quiet, but you realize your computer is being scanned. A hidden Rock vessel hails you: "Why do you fill your computer with lies?! These are not the holy words!" Before you can interject they open fire.
You notice a Rock ship performing combat exercises. However, they quickly change their course to engage your ship. They apparently treat unregistered alien ships as handy target practice.

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUTO_FRONTIER
textList.text: It comes to no surprise to find an automated forward scout of the Rebel fleet so far out lurking amongst the stars. A fight is unavoidable.
You have arrived at an uninhabited system with no signs of colonization, except for a Rebel Autonomous scout exploring this beacon and they do not seem willing to share their discoveries with you.

Sensor readings reveal the remains of an ill-fated Union Carryship, once brimming with hopeful colonists, now a lifeless derelict adrift in this beacon's vicinity. As you cautiously draw nearer to investigate, a Rebel Automated ship abruptly emerges from the wreckage, swiftly transitioning from its hiding place to a predatory stance, ready to seize its next victim.
One of the Rebels unmanned scout ships has been spotted patrolling around the frontier. Its AI considers you a significant threat! A fight is unavoidable.

Emerging from your FTL jump, you find yourself in a mesmerizing binary star system. The view is breathtaking, yet amidst the celestial spectacle, a lone Rebel forward automated scout lurks nearby, a grim omen of an imminent clash that cannot be avoided.

The Rebel Engineers have been busy in this sector to help pave the way for the Rebellions expansion. Thus, it's hardly astonishing to encounter one alongside its automated guardian, which promptly changes course to intercept you, while the engineering vessel hastily jumps away at the slightest hint of trouble.
You discover a nearby planet speckled with settlements, although none respond to your hails and you come to realize why; as an automated Rebel Ship comes speeding towards you..

You discover a nearby planet speckled with settlements, one of them hails you. â€œCaution! The Rebels have claimed this system. It isnâ€™t safe for-â€ the transmissions begins to break up. A Rebel Automated ship seems to be the source of the disruption and now it locks onto you and begins its assault.
A Rebel autonomous scout is exploring this beacon. You attempt to hide behind a nearby moon, but the ship finds you and begins its assault.
The AI of a nearby small Rebel scout immediately identifies you as a threat and engages.

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_FRONTIER
textList.text: You are taken aback by the beauty of a nearby eclipse glowing radiantly from a nearby planetoid. You would have considered this a fortuitous moment to arrive just in time to witness such an event; if not for the familiar sounds of a Rebel ship hailing to state their intentions of eliminating you once and for all.

This system is relatively undocumented and to your surprise, your ships sensors have detected various belts and moons rich and abundant of natural resources to any prospective frontiersmen that would be interested in settling in these partsâ€¦ even more surprisingly your sensors have detected a Rebel ship that doesnâ€™t wish to share with you this systems discovery.

Itâ€™s uncommon to see manned Rebel ships this far out from any nearby fleet elements especially in neutral sectors such as these. You receive a transmission: â€œItâ€™s you! Surrender to the talons of the Rebellion or face our wrath!â€
A defiant Rebel hail disrupts the harmonious backdrop, declaring, 'Our war won't end until we've shattered your Federation dreams!' Weapons lock on and going hot.
A Rebel ship contacts you near the emerging colonies, promising a 'safer world' for the frontier. Though they must have a different idea of what safe means as their weapons arm.
A Rebel fighter's boastful hail is silenced as you prepare to engage in combat, cutting off their rhetoric against the sector's calm.
In this sector of astronomic wonders, your arrival and a Rebel ship's coincide, leaving no choice but to clash amidst the untouched expanse.
A Rebel ship's boastful hail is silenced as you prepare to engage in combat, cutting off their rhetoric against the sector's calm, introducing discord to the once untouched expanse.

You have emerged to what appears to be a Rebel FOB being constructed on a nearby moon and they appear to have made us out! A Rebel ship breaks off from guarding the Riggers setting the base up and moves in to engage.

You have arrived at this beacon and began going through your checklists before making for the next jump while the drive charges. But unbeknownst to you it seems a fledgling colony below does not fancy your arrival and has sent for a Rebel ship to expedite your departure.
It isn't a surprise that the Rebels have also shown interest in this sector, even more so attemtping to protect their claims here by attacking you on sight!
Caught off guard by a Rebel ship near the burgeoning colonies, A confrontation is unavoidable with the mute ship refusing hails and entering an attack vector.
A Rebel ship has been patrolling this region collecting 'tariffs' on the nearby colonists. But as soon as you arrive it begins its assault.
You receive a transmission: "Sorry sir, this is nothing personal but we're under orders." The Rebel ship's weapons go hot.
A Rebel ship hails. "We did not fight a war to let a single Federation ship shatter our dreams of a better galaxy!" He locks weapons.
You're hailed by a Rebel ship: "When the rebellion is complete you'll see the safer world we provide. Well, you won't, but you get the point." They arm weapons.
Your arrival coincides almost exactly with that of a Rebel ship. It's hard to know who is more surprised, but there is no option but to fight.
